column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Boom! I've seen this place on those tv food shows so many time I felt like I already ate here before I even came to Chicago. Loved the pie - there's the big debate about East Coast thin crust and midWest deep dish
column2: but as far as I'm concerned
column3: why debate? It's like the debate between fresh pasta and dry pasta. They're both awesome when done right! We have Unos in Boston
column4: but please. No comparison. Malnati's crust is so rich and almost buttery
column5: the sauce not too sweet. More sausage than I've ever had on pizza in my life.
